thread.title: TC Central headed to tennis state finals
thread.title_full: TC Central headed to tennis state finals

author: JAMES COOK jcook@record-eagle.com
title: TC Central headed to tennis state finals
text:
Record-Eagle file photo/Tessa Lighty TC Central headed to tennis state finals 
Traverse City Central’s Nate Michno and playing partner Ben Grams won the No. 2 doubles title at Thursday’s Division 1 regional in Midland. Posted: Thursday, October 8, 2015 8:33 pm TC Central headed to tennis state finals By JAMES COOK jcook@record-eagle.com Record-Eagle.com 
MIDLAND — Traverse City Central qualified for the Division 1 tennis state finals for the eighth year in a row, and had five flight champions in the process. 
The Trojans scored 27 team points to win Thursday's Division 1 regional at the Midland Community Tennis Center. Holt and Midland were tied for second, seven points behind. 
"We played some awesome tennis," Central coach Shane Dilloway said. 
Grand Blanc was fourth in the nine-team region with 16 points, with Traverse City West scoring seven for fifth. 
The finals are Oct. 16-17, also at the Midland Community Tennis Center. 
Dilloway, the first-year TC Central head coach, said extending the streak was a goal this season. 
"It's awesome to live up to the reputation of TC Central tennis," Dilloway said. 
The state seeding meeting is Monday, and Dilloway said he's hoping to get the Trojans several seeds in the finals. 
"I'm feeling confident about our No. 1 and 2 doubles," Dilloway said. 
The No. 1 doubles tandem of Parker Berden/Austin Wieland is 39-1 this season, while Ben Grams/Nate Michno owns a 37-3 mark. 
The Trojans took a title at all four doubles flights, and No. 4 singles player Andy Colombo took a fifth. 
Berden/Wieland defeated Grand Ledge 6-0, 6-0; Holt 6-3, 6-2; and Midland 6-2, 6-0 in the finals to go into the state finals with only one setback this season. 
Grams/Michno likewise went 3-0 on the day, beating Saginaw Heritage 6-0, 6-3; Grand Blanc 6-0, 6-3; and Midland 7-6 (2), 6-4. 
Ben Brown and Chase Berden improved their record to 29-8 with wins over Traverse City West (6-2, 6-1), Grand Blanc (6-2, 7-6 [5], 7-5) and Midland (5-7, 7-6 [2], 6-4) to take the No. 3 doubles crown. 
Luke Fagerstrom and Miguel Ferraro won No. 4 doubles and are 29-8 this season. They defeated TC West (6-1, 6-0), Grand Blanc (6-1, 6-0) and Midland (6-4, 6-4). 
Colombo is now 28-12 after taking all three of his matches, topping West (6-0, 6-0), Midland (6-7 [5], 6-2, 6-2) and Holt (6-0, 6-0) to win No. 4 singles. 
Michael Meindertsma posted a 2-1 mark, downing Davison (6-0, 6-0) and Holt (6-3, 7-6 [3]) before falling 6-3, 6-2 to Midland in the No. 3 singles finals. 
Jack Seymour and Hayden McNamara were each 1-1 at No. 1 and No. 2 singles. 
West had five flights win a match each. 
Mitch Winowiecki defeated Grand Ledge 6-0, 6-1 and A.J. Ebling topped Grand Ledge 6-0, 6-0 in singles play. 
Three Titans doubles teams won — Henry Linenger/Jake Newhouse over No. 3 seed Grand Blanc 1-6, 6-1, 6-3; Ean Fritch/Ty Ebling beat Lapeer 6-2, 6-2; and Mark Klein/Christian Julian won 7-5, 7-6 (2) against Saginaw Heritage. 
"We lost a lot of seniors last year," Titans coach Blake Bernard said. "Our team was pretty young. We've got a lot of guys who are coming along." Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
